thread.title: Uber preps defense for high-stakes lawsuit
thread.title_full: Uber preps defense for high-stakes lawsuit

author: Madeline Bilis
title: Uber preps defense for high-stakes lawsuit
text: Paolo Vescia Uber Technologies CEO Travis Kalanick. Uber filed a key motion in federal case that could… more Uber is revving up its fight against a class-action lawsuit that aims to make Uber drivers company employees, not independent contractors. The financial stakes are high for Uber. If the lawsuit continues as class action, drivers' expenses such as vehicles, gas and maintenance, plus benefits like workers’ compensation would apply to more than 160,000 California drivers. Requiring drivers to become employees would be an expensive turn on its head for Uber’s business model, and could affect other startups thriving in the 1099 economy, like Lyft and Postmates. In a new motion issued on Thursday, the ride-hailing app argued that the lawsuit shouldn't be certified as a class action. Related Content
